metadata.title: CVE-2020-15653 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An iframe sandbox element with the allow-popups flag could be bypassed whenusing noopener links. This could have led to security issues for websitesrelying on sandbox configurations that allowed popups and hosted arbitrarycontent. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, andThunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
